messages.message: @JD the questions are based on those policy guidance updates

For now, please consult with your manager if you are working with a customer that may need to have access to ib_llm_tools *before* giving that access to the customer.

As a leadership team, we are aware of the nuances and challenges around this. EPD are currently evaluating the work that would be required to track LLM usage from Refiner, but this would only be available from 24.04 release at the earliest.

In the meantime, we will handle each customer on a case by case basis. Customers we are aware of that are in this situation are:
• Cass
• RSA
• VRSF
• RenRe
Please reach out to LT directly if you have questions or concerns

Sounds good - as you say this is for Cass, who have been working with the LLMs since ~November and have been on GPT-3.5 - from our side we will highlight the GPT-4 policy change to the developers specifically and what this means for them (i.e don’t use `advanced=True` for now going forward). We can make it about rate limits and how that affects their scale specifically for their context.

@BG @Venkatesh @Atul Grover we can discuss where else within Cass we need to be highlighting this and if/how we can highlight it with them from a licensing perspective
